title.narrative: Food Security and Livelihood opportunities for Rural Communities - Poultry Keeping Project

description.narrative:
This is a one year project seeking to promote food security and livelihood opportunities for Rural Communities affected by HIV and AIDS by promoting Poultry Farming in Homabay Diocese. The project activities have been developed to complement an existing Integrated food Security Project that works to promote agro-enterprise and income diversification for households in Homa Bay county.
The rational of the project is that HIV and AIDS affects the most active members of the labour force; it reduces earnings and imposes huge costs on all economic activities. Most activities of the main project are primarily labour intensive and require significant inputs of time and energy. Learning from the main Integrated Food Security Project (IFSP) largely informed this project design.
From April 2017 to March 2018, with funding from The Jerusalem Trust, the partner implemented a one-year poultry keeping project. During the year, Caritas Homa Bay organised families affected by HIV and AIDS into 60 poultry farming and enterprise groups. Our partner equipped 350 group members with skills on good poultry rearing practices including proper housing and hygiene, feeding, disease management and the safe disposal of poultry manure. The groups were trained on poultry production including poultry as a source of food and income, and how to create job opportunities for other members of the community along the poultry value chain.
With additional funding from Jerusalem Trust the partner will sustain successes from year 1 in the period April 2019 to March 2020 by:
- Addressing challenges including access to poultry feeds, poultry diseases and egg handling. - Supporting the originally established five Poultry Enterprise Groups to scale up production and make a return on investment. - Reaching the wider community through training on poultry production in order to access nutritious food and sell poultry for profit at market.
